title: Any 1 experiencing MAssive FPS Drops post pre-season?

embed.description: The easy way to save screenshots, GIFs, and websites. Make everyone happy by sharing smarter, faster, and with your point crystal clear.

body:
CPU: FX-8320
GPU:1050ti

Since pre-season lunched randomly i would get  random dips in fps drops and its only in league of legends  . Normally get 150-170 fps it dips to 5 to 30 fps at points for periods of time then goes back up. WOndiring if anyone else got this problem and if you do what can i do to fix this?


Edit: thank for the replies everyone much appreciate it

replies.body:
I saw a few of these reports last week (more than usual), and raised them to a few teams that have the manpower to track them down. I don't have any form of update for you, but it doesn't seem like a small subset of players have been experiencing this, and it doesn't appear to be hardware related. Hoping to know more tomorrow (I'm going to talk to the teams that were investigating).

UPDATE: So as it turns out, the nature of this issue is rather finicky and hard to track down. We're going to be sending out instructions to everyone that playtests daily so that in the event they experience the fps drop, they can just use a command to spit out a performance dump and our engineers can look at the trace file. Given the occurrences of this, I'd expect that we could "hopefully" repro it soon and figure out a fix!

I have an issue where I lose all new frames for about ~1 second every once in a while, but my FPS doesn't change radically (UI reports a drop of maybe 5-10 right after the lost frames, but then goes back to normal). 

Is that likely to be the same issue that you're investigating? Or is the issue you're reporting a more consistent FPS drop over a few seconds?

> [{quoted}](name=Maxxston,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=1Ot1fIJK,comment-id=00050007,timestamp=2017-11-13T18:25:22.377+0000)
>
> I have an issue where I lose all new frames for about ~1 second every once in a while, but my FPS doesn't change radically (UI reports a drop of maybe 5-10 right after the lost frames, but then goes back to normal). 
> 
> Is that likely to be the same issue that you're investigating? Or is the issue you're reporting a more consistent FPS drop over a few seconds?

I've been having a similar issue. A decent portion of the time I've been playing with a duo partner on the same internet connection and I will intermittently have a FPS drop as you're describing where all frames are lost for about a second, but when it's over I see my MS spike and then immediately return to normal; yet my duo partner on the exact same connection does not experience this at all. It leads me to believe that it is either something computer specific or possibly something related to the game that is affecting my computer and not my duo's.

Don't know if this is a more common issue or if we're just an anomaly; regardless it would be great to have this addressed.

Nightblue3 complained about this stuff on his steam, he tried messing with his settings and all manners of stuff but was not able to fix it as far as i know.

But the situation was the he would randomly have large FPS drops for no apparent reason, he could just be on his way to jungle from base and it would suddenly start.

I am fairly sure his PC is good, at least compared to the average toaster we commoners use. 

I myself have been lucky enough to avoid it though x)

Yeah the issue is definitely there. Pretty powerful machine (last generation processor and 1080 graphic card) and my game sometimes goes crazy. Also I'm having huge delays in champion select when swapping or editing rune pages and skins (sometimes everything will just block completely)

I've noticed it happens with Dark Harvest a lot. It seems like the particles from that, along with particles showing when somebody has a comet ready to fire are eating up A TON of computing power. Maybe try to track it down through those avenues?

Just lookup what was different few patches before when we had no problems , like for instance maybe the new rune visuals are bugged and take so much resources, maybe pre work for new resource bars are not compatible with old ones that are still in place on live servers,can be some sound effects that new rune make, etc. I really hope you guys fix it soon cause it is happening only in this patch and very rarely before but now like 99% of the games i am playing.

It's strange because I've seen a lot of people saying that they're experiencing FPS drops; even though I DO experience FPS drops too about once or twice every game ( I don't think it's fatal ), my ping is greatly affected instead. My usual normal ping is 240-250ms (it's not bad internet, I live in the opposite side of the world from U.S), but now it has been hanging around 260-270ms ( I know it's not much, but hear me out ), usually it shouldn't make much difference but instead the game itself felt like 500ms. Spells and sounds were occasionally delayed (about 2 or 3 seconds later, and everything plays all at once like BOOM), sometimes movement is sliding instead of playing the walking animation, and I do get "attempting to reconnect" message every 2 games or so. 

Usually if I get the "attempting to reconnect" message, I wait for a couple of seconds until the message disappears (I reconnected), I can clearly see my ping jumped to 1000+ms, so I know that's my internet's fault. But these past few days my ping doesn't change at all, it stays on 260-270ms even after "attempting to reconnect" messages.

So far I haven't seen anyone else with the same issue as mine so I'm actually believing that it's my internet's fault. But then again I can play Overwatch with smooth 20ms and no delays at all :/

Thank you. And yes please do, the game gets pretty unplayable at some points in the game. Throughout teamfights the fps even gets to low 20s for me. And with my setup, prior to the update I never went below 60 fps even in like 60 minute + games.
I've been having this same issue as well.  I appreciate the update.

Can confirm that I've also been having this problem. I played a TON of games on the PBE, and I noticed I was getting FPS drops in late game team fights. I then played no less than 10 games on live (7.21 at the time), and I experienced no such issues.

EXACTLY.
Same specs, alone in lane without any tf i get some drops until 25-30 fps.
FFS

i have a similar problem accept every once in a while i will play lol then the next day the frame rate will go from 100+ to being stuck at 30 frames ive tried anything i could think of and anything the internet said and it still hasnt fixed it self please help

> [{quoted}](name=Eternal Phoenix,realm=OCE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=1Ot1fIJK,comment-id=000f,timestamp=2018-12-07T06:14:16.046+0000)
>
> i have a similar problem accept every once in a while i will play lol then the next day the frame rate will go from 100+ to being stuck at 30 frames ive tried anything i could think of and anything the internet said and it still hasnt fixed it self please help


WHAT IS THIS?!
NECROMANCY?!
BEGONE!
https://images.freeimages.com/images/premium/previews/1343/13430476-holding-a-cross.jpg

The game just freeze suddenly and the fps goes to 15, i got this problam only in LOL.
I tryd to cancel v -sync in nvidia control panel and the game but not change...

RIG: 
970 gtx
i5-4460 3.20Ghz.

This Porblam is RLY ennoying & Playing now feels like Shit.{{sticker:zombie-brand-clap}}

Having the same problem with slightly different specs than you. My ping is great since I have a fiber connection, not seeing any change in ping during the FPS drops. Mine started at the beginning of preseason.
im getting them as well, which means i can no longer watch twitch while playing ;-;

Try messing around with different settings.

There was a bug a while back that caused massive FPS drops when you'd fill up any non-mana animated resource bar.
Spaghetti code man.

> [{quoted}](name=deadlychuck,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=1Ot1fIJK,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-11-13T02:46:33.822+0000)
>
> Try messing around with different settings.
> 
> There was a bug a while back that caused massive FPS drops when you'd fill up any non-mana animated resource bar.
> Spaghetti code man.

I normally run the game at high settings. However I literally do not see a difference in my FPS when I drop the settings down. Something weird is going on here

That's why i said something about the animated resource bar. I don't think it's something that's going on with your GPU. So the actual settings with regards to traditional FPS aren't likely the cause. 

There's probably some identifiable pattern, but it's just too spread out for most people to pick up on it.
that actually might b the culprit because arcane comet makes your mana bar glow to an off-blue white. Idk tho

Same here.. 
CPU: i5 6500K
GPU: Radeon rx480

Run the game capped at 140 (or maybe 144? Whichever is on there), max settings.. I haven't paid attention to how much the fps actually drops, but I have been getting some fps drops for seemingly no reason; as far as I remember, none of them occurred during any actual gameplay, just during walking to lane or the like, but it still surprised me- this never EVER happened to me before preseason hit!

after i disabled shadows completely and put on low performance mode i no longer have FPS drops whatsoever , ekko was the first culprit where him casting ANY spells just took me down from 60fps to 13 lol! a few other champs did the same but i dont know what you did to effects , or how this is even happening when you´ve 0 GPU changes listed ... or did you.

I just saw post about that kid of issue at reddit.
One user wrote "
> A year ago I was getting 400fps, now I'm getting 200fps. I don't think it's my machine that is failing as other games still rune fine and my system isn't even overclocked in the slightest.

I'll just copy & my response for him there:
> I'm (for example) playing at toaster. Seriously: P2C 2,8 GHz, 2 GB Ram and Geforce 9500 GT. "Earlier earlier" I remember I was playing at ~"medium", and now I must play at "utlra low". But to be honest earlier i had old screen with 1024x1280 resolution. Now I play in full HD.
> I also have antivirus (Kaspersky Free) and it's working somehow in background...
> But LoL is still playable for me (but i don't have stable 60 FPS), it's not unplayable, like some people writing & I assume, that they have PC - not a toaster like me.
> Maybe you can upgrade GPU drivers? Maybe you can upgrade CPU drivers (at least I know that kind of things exist)? Maybe you can upgrade Windows? Maybe you can upgrade other programs which works with LoL (I don't know: Java 8? Microsoft .NET Framework? Microsoft Visual C++?) I'm not saying, that this will help: I'm saying "maybe". Maybe you have some virus/trojan?
> I don't know - I'm not a specialist. BUT I have all that things patched, scanned, seems clear, I'm even updating my "Ethernet Controller Driver" and... It's not a disaster with my toaster, like some people says...
> But overall I'll admit - yeah, I also think, that there are probably some things to fix in client/game.
I've also experienced some pretty bad frame drops with the new patch.

I've had bad drops this pre-season,
CPU AMD Ryzen 1700
GPU GTX 1080
16 gigs of corsair vengeance ram.
This is some HERESY

I dunno about FPS drops, but I've been having slight sporadic lag spikes lately (only up to 200 I think, normally I'm around 30-40 ping) in my games. Already checked lag report and it's not my provider. Though I'm stuck on Wifi (no possible way to connect my laptop to an ethernet cord), I'm rather close to the router.
I know Mac users have been having FPS drops for a patch before preseason (7.21?) so, if you have a Mac, this is likely the cause and Riot hasn't made any comments on it after almost 3 weeks.

Yep, but way lower specs than yours. I typically play at 30 FPS capped. Every couple of minutes or so it will randomly drop to single-digits for up to a couple seconds. This doesn't appear to be attached to any particular screen effects, it just happens.
have the same problem with almost same specs.
